annotations.description: Mulled Cider is a tradition around this time of year that goes way back, so I'm making some Elizabethan style Wassail! Get in here and a Wassailing we go! **...
annotations.title: Wassail Traditional Mulled Cider | How to Drink

textContent:
Ingredients
4 small apples
1 Orange
Sugar
Hard Cider - 2 quarts or 2 liters
Port Wine - 4 oz
Maderia Wine - 4 oz 
Nutmeg - teaspoon
Ginger - tablespoon
2 Cinnamon Sticks
6 All-Spice Berries
13 Cloves
6 Eggs
Cognac (optional)

Process:
Core 4 small apples and fill with sugar, I prefer a demerara here.
Pierce the skin of the orange with 13 cloves
Bake both together for about 40 minutes at 350 degrees fahrenheit, but keep an eye on them.  These overcook easily.

In saucepan combine:
2 qts. -or- 2 liters of hard cider
2 cinnamon sticks
6 all-spice berries
~ 1 tsp. -or- 5 ml. nutmeg
~ 1 Tbs. -or- 15 ml. Ginger
Heat till simmering and let continue

In mixing bowls:
Separate 6 eggs
beat whites to stiff peaks
Beat yolks (with 1/4-1/2 cup of sugar if wanted) to lighten color
fold together

Add to the simmering cider:
4 oz. -or- 240 Ml. Port
4 oz. -or- 240 ml. Madeira

Temper the eggs with some of the warm cider
In large bowl mixing combine the eggs and the cider
In serving bowl arrange the baked fruit and pour the wassail over,
